Contributor: Heywood Strasser & Voigt Litho. Co., lithographer.;
Note: Date based on America's participation in the war. "7C" appears on the bottom left of the poster. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Text tells of an honor button given when one subscribes to the victory Liberty Loan, and says that every American should consider it an honor to wear this button. Illustration shows the Liberty Loan button.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Publisher: New York : Heywood Strasser & Voigt Litho. Co.,
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
Subject: Liberty bonds -- United States.; World War, 1914-1918 -- Propaganda.; War posters, American.;

Title: Honor button
